column9: Yes, I want to describe to Frabiché's newsletter!
column10: Project Description
TRAY_02

I've always wanted a crank radio and now in these uncertain times more than ever! However, they all look sooooo boring and frankly, really ugly. FANCR, or Finally A Nice Crank Radio, is a concept of mine where I reimagined the aesthetics of the standard crank radio by giving it a modern facelift! Thank you guys!

Coffee Table
Personal Project | 2024
A coffee table with dynamic highs and lows, where the dipping sections form the legs, doubling as perfect spots for storing your favourite reading material.

Emy stool. Emy collection is unique collection of chairs, stools, tables and more, that creates organic and spacious appearance using only flat sheets of veneer, maintaining the signature design of rea.l.design studio. Often rea.l.design studio focuses on pressed veneer furniture, but to achieve same appearance with more efficiently and make the furniture more accessible , clever design makes a flat sheet of plywood create a new perception of what is achievable with single sheet of plywood. Stool is made out of oak, birch, pine plywood.

In the fast-paced rhythm of modern life, parents often face the challenge of balancing work, household responsibilities, and quality time with their children. Inspired by this reality, an innovative project has been developed that combines tradition and technology: an AI-based children's flashlight-projector, "Boozie."

Boozie is designed to transform bedtime storytelling into an interactive experience. Equipped with microphones that capture the narration, and Meta AI generating real time images, Boozie projects these images onto the wall, allowing the child to visually explore the story. The device offers two modes of use:

• Ambience mode, which projects complete scenarios to immerse the child in the story.
• Character mode, which allows users to customize and project the story's characters.

Boozie not only fosters imagination and strengthens family bonds, but also promotes creative and responsible use of technology.

A reimagined invention of what a digital vinyl could look like. Borrowing from nostalgic elements like discman and actual vinyl players. This further solves for the need to stand so close to a regular vinyl before you can see what is actually playing. Minimalistic in nature and only solves for playing albums. The product software would be a sync with mobile devices with its own music library where only albums are available. This is where the vinyl inspiration comes in, portable and with antique-like form which makes it very distinguishable. The colour choice drives in to a merge with contemporary feel of what products are.

The Color Maker is a cutting-edge vending machine designed for hair salons, serving as an automatic hair dye dispenser. The system enables hairdressers, barbers, and other professionals to select the desired dye color via a large 15-inch touchscreen. Each color is assigned a unique code, and the machine ensures exceptional accuracy by blending 10 different shades of dye with hydrogen peroxide.The automated dispensing process minimizes physical strain, reducing the need for manual preparation.
For the design of the automated dispenser, we worked closely with the client across multiple areas, delivering a turnkey solution that included industrial design, electronics, software interface development, and detailed production drawings for mass manufacturing. This project was developed for an innovative startup, which is set to launch the device in both the Italian and international markets soon.
Toolip is a set of gardening tools inspired by the shape of tulip. It is consisted of a trowel, a shovel, a rake and a basket to store other items.

The Kanso chair is inspired by Japanese temple gate architecture. Designer sees architecture and product design as a single unit, just at different scales. This chair utilizes key structural elements of architecture, resulting in excellent structural integrity and an expressive silhouette that is highly recognizable. While the pressed veneer shape structures the chair to create a unique silhouette and adds designers signiture, the addition of structurally interlocking elements ties together the two different design languages and creates harmony throughout the Kanso chair. Thanks to the pressed veneer, the designer achieved an excellent weight-to-strength ratio, making it extremely durable yet lightweight. The Kanso chair is made from ash veneer and solid ash.

Originally designed out of experimentation and necessity the grid shelf was a practical solution to a common problem, a lack of storage.  The first few units were made for a college dorm, later moved to a childhood bedroom, and eventually the first apartment.  We noticed how most furniture is difficult to disassemble and move from one home to the next while being single purpose. We wanted to design a kit of parts that can be added and subtracted depending on your needs and sizing constraints.  We produced a few grid shelfs for a set designer when they needed a set piece for a low budget commercial that needed to fit the whole set into an Uber. We realized quickly that this system needed to be expanded to accommodate a variety of uses. 
By designing a modular flat pack storage system, three parts can produce six ready-to-ship items that can accommodate almost any space.

Currently we are producing 1-5' sections and now just added "tops" with 10 parts were able to have over 25+ different builds as well as being able to orient them vertically or horizontally.  The goal is to make furniture that solves common problems with practical solutions.

The EVE Odyssey is the latest masterpiece from Bandit9. Many of their works, including variations of the EVE, are part of historic collections in the some of the most prestigious museums around the world, such as the Petersen in LA and the the Museum of Modern Art in Australia.

Bandit9 thrives at the intersection of art and engineering to create fully-functioning motorcycles that belong to a world 50 years into the future. They place emphasis on creating vehicles with silhouettes "so simple, so memorable, a child can draw them," says Bandit9 Chief, Daryl.

The EVE Odyssey takes its design cues from the Jet Age, a golden era defined by optimism and progress. The EVE Odyssey, as Van Daryl says, "symbolizes what could be, not what is." Its Concorde-esque shape, its use of space-grade aluminum, and an engine so efficient a single tank can take you to the edge of space and back, are some of the details that makes this space-age bike so ahead of what's available currently.

The EVE Odyssey is limited to 9 units only, each handmade with personalization options. Whether it's part of your art collection or your stable of rare vehicles, the EVE Odyssey will feel right at home.

Betty is a portable lantern that resonates with the ancient Betty lamp in contemporary.
It allows people to use it as a portable illumination.

The archetype is assembled by a diffuser and a base that has a handle in a race shape, the device could be sitting on a charging tray. 
Designed with a two-cylinder corn structure, it offers versatility by allowing users to place it in two orientations, akin to flipping. Additionally, a handle on the side enables easy transportation to the backyard or hanging it securely.

The interaction has two ways. Switch on and off by pressing the diffuser in the normal stand or pressing the base once it is upside-down. To dim the brightness by rotating the diffuser.

Bonk is a playful table lamp that reimagines the classic spherical lamp design with a unique and dynamic twist. Inspired by the moment a ball collides with a sheet (and sounds “bonk”), it captures this instant of impact, creating a shape that blends movement with stillness. 
Bonk's minimalist form offers both functional lighting and an artistic presence, making it an ideal piece for modern living spaces. The design is brought to life through a carefully curated colour palette of Tiger Orange, Sand, Sunrise Yellow, and Stone, which evoke warmth, energy, and subtlety. Each hue complements the lamp's playful aesthetic while enhancing its connection to natural elements. 
The design is optimised for 3D printing using FDM technology, eliminating the need for support structures during production and reducing material waste. The lamp is crafted from PLA, a biodegradable and sustainable material, emphasizing its commitment to environmentally conscious design.
Combining aesthetics with sustainability, Bonk encourages the use of alternative technologies for producing beautiful home decor and sets a precedent for the future of home decor, where creativity, functionality, and environmental impact coexist harmoniously.

Aria
 Aria is an ironic concept that tries to be innovative, so take it as one.
 Reflecting on the issue of smoking- a habit enjoyed by many (myself included) despite its
 health risks- I wondered how to reconsider the act of smoking. And thought what if we were
 already “smoking”, but the substances we were inhaling were in the wrong physical state?
 Yes, I am referring to air.
 This idea led to a deeper realization about air pollution, especially with the growing concerns
 about high pollution levels. What began as a humorous idea turned into a possible solution
 addressing two issues at once: a smoking device that suimulates the act of smoking while
 purifying the air it inhales.
 Aria was born from this blend of irony and practicality, highlighting the contradictions in our
 habits while addressing the serious issue of air quality. Though it started as a lighthearted
 idea, Aria has the potential to change smoking habits and improve personal health.
 Aria is packed with an infrared gas sensor to monitor air quality, HEPA filters for clean air
 intake, and a micro nebulizer and dehumidifier. This setup collects clean air in water form
 inside a natural fiber sponge. The sponge releases the water as the nebulization process
 starts, ensuring a cleaner, healthier smoking simulation.
 And I’d really like @dyson to help me make it real

In today’s fast-paced technological landscape, where sustainability and user-centred solutions are increasingly prioritized, industrial design is crucial for tackling pressing societal issues. This master’s thesis project explores the intersection of innovative and emerging technologies, such as AI and generative design, sustainability, and user-centred design principles, in the context of prosthetic socket design. With a focus on enhancing the functionality, comfort, and accessibility of prosthetic devices, this research endeavours to contribute to the advancement of inclusive and impactful design solutions.

Employing a design-driven approach that encompasses iterative prototyping and user-centred assessment, this thesis is not solely about pushing the boundaries of industrial design; it’s about empowering individuals. Its ultimate objective is to empower prosthetic users, granting them a sense of inclusiveness, dignity, and independence. The research recognizes the intricacies of designing for the human body and mind and is steered by an in-depth comprehension of user needs and experiences.

This project paves the way for future research and development, offering hope for individuals with limb loss and fostering positive change in industrial design, thereby transforming the landscape of prosthetic socket solutions.
Hio k

The beams of light seeping between the columns were merged with the idea of a window opening to the sea. While the side wings of the product serve as a column and window abstraction, the glass texture creates a sensation of the sea. It was shaped to reflect the impression of the sea seen on the shore when the light is turned on.

Modular sofa BG-P-14 concept.
The modules can transform space in different ways, creating the shape of a snake or a closed elongated torus for public spaces or showrooms, or offices. Covering - micro velour, which makes the seat pleasant to the touch and gives a pleasant iridescence of color. The option of adding a coffee table is also available.

PATHFINDER, A Journey to your ultimate mouse

The most important factor in a gaming mouse for FPS games are shapes. But mouse shapes on the market today are usually clones of popular ones that already exist. There had never been a mouse design that puts the gamer first

INSTEAD OF MAKING A SHAPE THAT SOMEWHAT FITS TEN THOUSAND. WE'RE CREATING ONE THAT FITS ONLY YOU

We’ve spent the last two years perfecting the ultimate FPS mouse— endlessly adaptable to your unique grip style and effortlessly responsive to every swipe, snipe, and snap fire.

Hundreds of hand scans and match analyses gave us two insights:
hand size and finger placement are key. But no mouse could be
custom-fit to every gamer...until now

Adjust Pathfinder’s width and length to fit your palm like a second
skin. Then, refine it with pro-approved shapes that align seamlessly
with your grip.

Pathfinder isn’t just a mouse—it’s a journey to create the ultimate FPS
peripheral, uniquely yours and adaptable to any game or playstyle you
want to master

A JOURNEY TO YOUR ULTIMATE MOUSE

Meet PATHFINDER, your Ultimate FPS Mouse
Modular, Fine-Tune Shape to Fit Grip & Playstyle

Makes Changing Shapes a Gamechanger
2500+ Configs made with Pros 
Lightweight. 53-59g 
Top Sensor & MCU 
4K Polling Rate 
Pre-order 1st Oct, 
Ship Q1 25 
Endgame shape, Refined by pros, Defined by you

DuoCare is a 2-in-1 tool that combines a toothbrush and tongue scraper into one compact, travel-friendly product. This concept aims to simplify the amount of tools used in their daily dental care routines, making it easier for people on the go to maintain their oral hygiene.

Chikais a toothbrush with replaceable heads.
Its handle is made of recycled plastic and heads are made of cxp(Cellulose Cross-linked Polymer).

Cesto means a basket case in Spanish. The inspiration for the Cesto collection comes from the shape of this object, which is typical in many cultures and is used to collect or store other objects. They have a characteristic shape and are usually made of rattan or other natural fibers.

The Cesto chair has a unique shape. Its main feature is its complex appearance, with the simplicity of its construction. 

Available in different colors options.

Artefilo is an independent industrial design studio committed to creating unique, eco-friendly homeware. Our designs blend distinctive forms, colours, and textures, offering customers a uniquely stylish and practical addition to their homes. 

Our products are created with 3D printing technology using a blend of recycled plastics, organic materials sourced from nature, and manufacturing waste. We conduct thorough research into the origins of our materials and exclusively select 100% recycled filament blends that can be traced back to their sources. This approach ensures that everything we produce follows a circular and sustainable process. 

Our products are primarily made from r-PLA (Recycled Polylactic Acid) and r-PETG (Recycled Polyethylene Glycol Terephthalate). These materials can be reclaimed up to six times, regenerating new products without creating additional waste. We also blend waste-driven, organic materials into our foundational recycled filaments, including wood chips, dirt, rice, grass, durum (pasta), glass waste, coffee beans, wine residue, and sea shells. Because of our location and our tendency to constantly experiment with new materials, we are investigating whether printing products with cheese-based recycled filaments is possible. More on this will be coming soon.

Each of our products is meticulously designed, printed, tested, and assembled on demand in our studio in Edam, Noord-Holland. This hands-on approach reflects our commitment to creating distinctive, circular products that can be easily customized to our customers' unique tastes and furtherly reduce material waste.

This wooden and paper sideboard is deeply inspired by the traditional architecture of Kyoto's temples, where the graceful overhangs of the roofs seem to float in the air, defying gravity with serene lightness. Just like these structures, our design seeks the same harmony, with a solid base but a body that projects outward, creating a sense of weightlessness.

The paper panels covering the doors are crafted with the delicate artistry of washi, highlighting the craftsmanship passed down through centuries of Japanese culture. In every detail, the sideboard honors the wabi-sabi aesthetic: beauty in imperfection and transience, with natural wood grains and slight imperfections in the paper that tell stories of authenticity and time. This piece of furniture does more than serve; it lives, balancing simplicity and depth in perfect communion with its surroundings.

Apollo is a solar indoor lamp inspired by the shape of the candles. The purpose is to create a light that accompanies the user during the everyday moments, as well as candles did in the past. The lamp, thanks to its cylindrical form with a cap containing the solar panel can be used in three different modes: standing with the cap at the bottom, recalling the iconic candles with their small plates; standing with the cap at the top, recalling the minimalistic Japanese taste of the pagodas; and hanging on, thanks to the cord that embraces the cap. This rope allows the lamp to fit every scenario to collect the solar light and charge the batteries. The name Apollo comes from the Greek myth of the homonymous god of Sun to remark the solar-powered supply that animates the lamp.

Hi,

We hope this message finds you well.

We are Julian and Aster, reaching out to submit our recent lighting design, Grid Extrusion, for editorial consideration. 

Grid Extrusion draws inspiration from the intricacies of machinery and the directional qualities of light. The design embraces a raw, industrial aesthetic, consisting of a honeycomb lattice cube with translucent sheets slicing through its body, creating rhythm and transforming the light it casts. The relationship meticulously balanced between the source and its modifying elements highlights the tension between light and its embodied form.

If you’re interested in featuring this design or learning more, we’d be happy to provide a press kit and any additional information. High resolution images available at the link bellow.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1R3Ic6fQ9pFvACvW2JuZ07TWkwdDOC-o9?usp=sharing

Additionally, if you’d like to experience the work in person, it will be showcased at Isola’s Disclosure event during Dutch Design Week 2024. It would be wonderful to see you there and share more about the project.

Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Warmest regards,

Julian & Aster

The book is mightier than the sword.

Personal Project | 2024
Inspired by the legendary tale of the Sword in the Stone, where Arthur proves his right to the throne by pulling the sword from the stone, I’ve designed a side table with a playful twist. While it may appear simple and similar to other designs on the market, this table features custom cutouts specifically for storing your favorite book, always ready for when you take your seat on your “throne” (or sofa). 

For larger books, there's an additional cutout at the table's base – simply flip the table until you find the perfect slot for your own Excalibur of books.

Introducing the second version of our dripper, where we have innovated both the material and design to enhance the previous iteration. This new version incorporates advanced materials and finishes, offering a fresh and distinctive look to the product.

Our dripper features an integrated stand and dripper mechanism, designed not only to optimize the coffee brewing process but also to serve as a static piece of art. We have carefully considered its presence when not in use, ensuring it complements its surroundings as a contemplative and elegant object.

Jurassic meets technology

Self project | 2023
Multisaurus is a USB multi-port. Its playful design is inspired by the stegosaurus, featuring USB ports on its back that resemble the dinosaur's distinctive kite-shaped plates.

With Multisaurus, you can connect multiple devices to your MAC or PC simultaneously without compromising style or creativity.

a minimalist side table designed with both aesthetics and sustainability in mind. This table is crafted from a single piece of plywood, maximizing efficiency and minimizing waste. Using CNC machining technology, this design ensures precision and elegance in every curve and edge.

•  Made from a single sheet of plywood, reducing material waste.
•  CNC machining allows for detailed and accurate production.
•  A clean, modern look that complements any interior style.
•  The inherent strength of plywood ensures a sturdy and long-lasting piece.

The inspiration behind this side table was to create a piece of furniture that is not only functional but also eco-friendly. By utilizing CNC machining, we can produce this table with minimal material waste, aligning with sustainable design practices. The simplicity of the design also reflects a minimalist aesthetic, making it a versatile addition to any space.

This decanter and glass set is inspired by the simple elegance of nature. It's upwardly tapering structure blends modern aesthetics, making it a striking piece in any setting. At the same time, it creates an aesthetic experience in the eyes of the users, adding visual depth and a sense of movement. The transparency of the glass accentuates the color and texture of the liquid inside, making presentations even more appealing. Glowing under natural light, this glass set is perfect for serving drinks to your guests, especially on special occasions. Combined with a minimalist design philosophy, these products stand out with their elegance and functionality. Their simple yet impressive structure promises to be a piece that will find a place on every table in every home.
Just what if Samsung made their ultra series red. Made with blender and Photoshop

Our passion for technology and music inspired us to initiate this internal tech project, where we dedicated ourselves to developing a custom product along with its branding, user interface, and motion advertisement.

From Product Design to creating a cohesive Brand Identity, with considerations for UI/UX and a product video reveal, we developed a comprehensive, full-circle campaign.

Our goal was to create a clean and minimal user experience that aligned with the product's sleek aesthetics. Beyond serving as a music player, we envisioned the product incorporating "small apps" to offer additional features.

All posters, fonts, and colors were carefully considered during the design phase to showcase the devices' various uses with maximum impact.

See our case study here: https://www.steelworks.studio/sw-1

Nothing aims to remove barriers between people and technology to integrate perfectly into everyday life to the point where it feels like "nothing."

Nothing also collaborates by actively interacting with users through the community. 
I imagined what it would be like if Nothing made a robotic vacuum cleaner, that works closely in life with artificial intelligence technology and sensors.

Hi, my name is Edoardo Gambino, I’m a mechanical and product designer and I designed Mecharm following my idea of design.
I worked for companies for years, building up mechanics and product design projects based on other people’s ideas. Several times I have proposed my design ideas, but they have never been considered due to my position. So I decide to quit off and start my projects, giving shape to my product ideas.
EG-Solution is me, and Mecharm is my first product.
Mecharm design is extreme. When I designed it I thought about something solid, more solid, but also cool and minimal. That kind of design can fit inside a lower office, inside a garage, or simply in your living room. 

The lines are studied to give a feel of strength and maintain the minimal essence. Due to my experience, I started applying my knowledge about physics and mechanics to this project, applying an engineering approach to design, and Mecharm is the result. 
Mecharm is an additional level for your desktop with a world-unique and over-the-edge design. This project includes several unique and active points for enthusiasts of design and mechanics like me.

The WB-01 is a double-insulated stainless steel water bottle featuring an integrated waterproof storage compartment. Designed for those who need extra space for essentials like vitamins, medications, or snacks. It combines functionality with a sleek, minimalist silhouette. Perfect for daily use, the WB-01 seamlessly blends style and practicality, making it an ideal companion for active lifestyles.

column2: Federico Redaelli, Edoardo Melchioni, Tiffany Melchioni, Luca Marcadent
column10:
BILLA is a rechargeable light source designed by EGOUNDESIGN to be portable and easy to handle thanks to its compact size, ergonomic shape, and lightweight design. Aimed at a dynamic and design-conscious audience, BILLA is the result of two years of research and development. The intuitive TWIST mechanism allows users to control the LED lighting by rotating the base. The magnetic base enables BILLA to attach to metallic surfaces, enhancing its functional versatility.
The project has already gained significant recognition in the design world, leading the EGOUNDESIGN team to be selected by Marva Griffin among the top under-35 designers at SaloneSatellite 2023, where they won third place the following year with their 3D printed brass project, VORONOI.

Features of BILLA
• Portability: Thanks to its compact and lightweight design, BILLA is easily transportable and can be used in various environments, both indoors and outdoors.
• Adjustable light tones: BILLA is equipped with 6 LEDs, offering the possibility to choose different light tones depending on the position of the base, allowing the lighting to be adjusted to different needs and atmospheres.
• Magnetic technology: The magnetic system allows BILLA to be placed on metallic surfaces without additional supports, offering great freedom of use and high functionality.
• Fast charging: Equipped with a battery lasting up to 4 hours and rechargeable via USB-C, BILLA provides a quick and convenient solution for extended use without interruptions, making it ideal for dynamic situations and various environments. The fast charging ensures a quick return to functionality.
• Internal compartment: In addition to lighting up, BILLA’s body includes an internal compartment for increased practicality and versatility, allowing it to hold various objects that can be kept close at hand.

The inspiration for this topic was the observation of people swimming recreationally in open waters. The ability to store things while swimming allows you to cover long distances or swim independently without worrying about items left on the shore. However, the solutions available on the market do not provide the freedom of movement necessary in this dynamic activity and do not guarantee safety and comfort.

Safe and convenient storage of personal items while swimming is possible thanks to the use of appropriate materials, technologies and forms.

After analyzing the design problem, I created a modular backpack. The combination of a vest made of fabric that is friendly to exposed skin and a body made of material resistant to external conditions provides the user with a comprehensive solution. 

The aim of this project is to provide freedom while swimming and to encourage people to take up this activity, which has many health-promoting features, connects us with nature and calms us down.

"Ergonomic HMI case"
This parametric design was brought to life using Rhino, Grasshopper, and FDM 3D print technology.
Can't wait to see where this journey takes me!

ALIEN Smartwatch is a wearable device that challenges conventional design. Inspired by organic aesthetics, this product has a bio-shaped design that seamlessly integrates cutting-edge technology with a stylish, futuristic allure.This smartwatch is designed not just to be worn but to be experienced. It features 4 customizable buttons, allowing users to assign functions and displays via smartphone. It also includes a built-in voice assistant for hands-free control.This accessory aims to evoke a sense of wonder and curiosity, making each glance at the watch a reminder of self-expression, unexplored possibilities of technology and design.
BreatheBetter   -   Futuristic Inhaler, with advanced composite-polymer materials and ergonomic shape

London-based creative studio INK has officially released its latest book, Automotive Type D. The book is the fourth in the studio’s series of auto books celebrating innovative design and cutting-edge technology. The 50-page volume highlights 20 projects, showcasing INK’s work for some of the world’s most forward-thinking automotive brands.
Featuring work with Polestar, McMurtry and Formula 1 legends, Type D offers a glimpse at the future of mobility through the studio’s sophisticated and effortless style. The book features work with photographers Amos Fricke and long-time studio collaborator, Benedict Redgrove, for Road & Track and The Road Rat. Also included are original artworks from INK’s Plainbodies and Brutal Beasts series.
"As a digital studio, we maintain a strong belief in the power of print to bring our work to life,” said David Macey, Executive Creative Director at INK. The book’s design, led by designer and illustrator ‘Mr Gresty’, is a stylish, hand-stitched testament to INK’s mission of launching the boldest innovations in the automotive world.
INK is a creative studio comprising artists and designers specialising in CGI, animation, and design. Working at the intersection of art and technology, INK is a future-focused studio creating global launches and original artwork across automotive, technology, fashion, life sciences, and luxury brands.
Toolip is a set of gardening tools inspired by the shape of tulip. It is consisted of a trowel, a shovel, a rake and a basket to store other items.

Introducing HoloLense glasses, futuristic glasses made from adaptive materials. They feature holographic lenses that project 3D displays for real-time info and navigation. With gesture controls and voice recognition, they seamlessly blend virtual and real worlds, all while staying stylish!

Puricooker is a multifunctional home appliance that combines a water purifier and a rice cooker into one product. 
By utilizing the functional intersection between a direct water purifier and a pressure rice cooker, 
Puricooker smartly performs the integrated functions of both appliances, making it a perfect fit for your kitchen.

'Blooming out' reflects an interior trend that values individual tastes and lifestyles, and is a router for users who are interested in smart homes.

This router improves the problems of existing routers, such as poor cable lines, long antennas that are concerned about appearance, and no usability other than Wi-Fi functionality.

When the Internet connection signal is unstable, we depend on the Wi-Fi icons or the lights on the router to check the connection strength. This makes the user frustrated, anxious, and unable to recognize the problem quickly.

'Blooming out' uses a fan like folding structure to suggest an interaction in which the structure folds when the signal is weak and the structure unfolds when the signal is strong. This maximizes visual effects and helps users know the instant Wi-Fi signal strength.

Origin Salt & Pepper Mill by studio enemy is a material study project. Crafted from Himalayan rock salt and sapele wood, these mills highlight the source and processes behind the origins of everyday flavours and spices. The pepper mill is stained with a lacquer made from black pepper (pepper nigrum) extract, enhancing its rich dark colour. The design aims to reconnect users with the source of their spices and foster a deeper appreciation for the craftsmanship behind these essential flavours.

While making my portfolio for September I decided the art direction will be around "screen".
I made a CRT screen from scratch using features and details form old Sony CRT I liked.

A concept watch inspired by the essence of gravity, designed to evoke both elegance and simplicity. With a touch on its face, the watch subtly illuminates the hour and minute hands, revealing the time through a soft, glowing display. This seamless interaction offers a refined and intuitive experience, blending function with minimalist beauty

PLANAR: A wine bottle that blends into its surroundings, becoming more than just a bottle — a piece of thoughtful design.
PLANAR’s distinctive form features a broad, stable base that not only commands attention but also provides security in storage and display. The design narrows at the middle, creating an ergonomic grip that makes pouring effortless while offering a sleek space for your label to shine.

It is a smartphone touchpad that allows you to use your smartphone with one hand. It is a device that allows you to control the screen of your smartphone with any hand or any finger freely with easy attachment and detachment through MacSafe. Its small, thin shape and light weight provide easy usability to carry anytime, anywhere.

We noticed how most furniture is difficult to disassemble and move from one home to the next while being single purpose. We wanted to design a kit of parts that can be added and subtracted depending on your needs and sizing constraints.   

We produced a few grid shelfs for a set designer when they needed a set piece for a low budget commercial that needed to fit the whole set into an Uber.

We realized quickly that this system needed to be expanded to accommodate a variety of uses. 

By designing a modular flat pack storage system, three parts can produce six ready-to-ship items that can accommodate almost any space.

Individual parts are available for sizing up or down. Whether you need more or less, the grid system moves with you.

Escargo’ is a single-wheeled electric vehicle concept, envisioned in a techy future of urban
 mobility.
 It integrates advanced gyroscopic self-balancing technology for intuitive control, allowing
 riders to steer through body movements without the need of traditional handlebars.
 The puncture-proof tire is designed to withstand urban debris, offering low-maintenance
 reliability.
 The vehicle also features adjustable side footrest for different heights and style of driving
 and a small digital display with basic information such as speed and directions.
 The vehicle is compact, portable, and easy to store, ideal for fast-paced city living.
 Though speculative, this design tries to address the future needs of urban commuting with a
 focus on efficiency, durability, and ease of use

Waflum designed this lamp using parametric design. The goal was to create an algorithm demonstrating how parametric design can be applied across different manufacturing technologies. Each version of the laser-cut lamp is unique, with no two identical pieces. The Grasshopper script generates 2D drawings, enabling the easy cutting of components, which can be assembled to create interesting geometries.

Braun
 I’ve recently revisited an old uni project focused on developing a versatile speaker system
 designed to enhance the listening experience. The way it’s designed allows the speaker to
 function on two levels: as a full stereo system when fully assembled, and as a modular
 sound system when detached, providing an immersive audio experience. Furthermore, the
 system supports adjustable volume levels, enabling simultaneous listening at different
 intensities, even if the users are not in the same space.
 The design allows singular use of the detachable speakers, so to have a packed and punchy
 speaker also for the outside to carry in your bag or backpack, but the idea of not giving the
 possibility of carrying the full system all together bothered me a bit, so I designed a strap
 carrying case, compact and functional (I am not fully sure it would work, but I am planning on
 digging deeper this aspect an will post more in regards to that)
 The detachable speakers are equipped with wireless charging coils for convenient
 recharging, and the system utilizes NFC technology to detect when the speakers are
 detached, automatically switching from stereo to individual speaker mode.
Gyeol is a brand that help individuals create beauty by focusing on their own beauty. It consists of a mascara for hairline and eye brow.
Toolip is a set of gardening tools inspired by the shape of tulip. It is consisted of a trowel, a shovel, a rake and a basket to store other items.

Firehawk is designed to aid agencies, firefighters or emergency services in detecting and monitoring fires in wildlands and remote woodland areas, by giving them critical aerial data to more effectively take action in emergency situations.  The drone is equipped with a visual-spectrum and an infrared thermal gimbal-mounted camera, and its motors can tilt vertically to allow the drone to take off in much tighter spaces without the need of a catapult or other launching methods.
column11: Firehawk, a drone for emergency wildfire firefighting operations

column10: Introducing my take on a Coat Stand, my creation that blends minimalist Scandinavian design with everyday functionality. I designed this piece to be simple, elegant, and highly practical. I focused on minimizing the number of parts for both simplicity and durability. It features just 3 main components, which not only makes it easy to assemble but also keeps the overall design clean and streamlined. It fits effortlessly into smaller spaces without overwhelming the room.

Flux is a uniquely crafted coffee table that embodies the essence of modern design. Seamlessly blending wood and metal, this piece captivates with its fluid lines and minimalist aesthetic. The reflective metal surface adds a touch of sophistication, capturing and playing with light in any room it occupies. The natural wood top provides warmth and a sense of organic beauty, perfectly complementing the cool, contemporary feel of the metal. Flux is not just a functional piece of furniture, but also a statement of style, adding elegance and character to any space it graces.

Hello, I recently did some product photography of the Oyster Tempo Cooler. I want to be clear that I am just the photographer - the designer is Ian Sandmael of Oyster. I think it is a great product so I wanted to submit it here.
Design of geiger counter that redefines this device as somehing that people can use daily by making it much simplier and better looking than traditional geiger counters.
Electronic hookah for regular hookah tobacco. 3D printed with carbon fiber PC.

Bonk is a playful table lamp that reimagines the classic spherical lamp design with a unique and dynamic twist. Inspired by the moment a ball collides with a sheet (and sounds “bonk”), it captures this instant of impact, creating a shape that blends movement with stillness. 
Bonk's minimalist form offers both functional lighting and an artistic presence, making it an ideal piece for modern living spaces. The design is brought to life through a carefully curated colour palette of Tiger Orange, Sand, Sunrise Yellow, and Stone, which evoke warmth, energy, and subtlety. Each hue complements the lamp's playful aesthetic while enhancing its connection to natural elements. 
The design is optimised for 3D printing using FDM technology, eliminating the need for support structures during production and reducing material waste. The lamp is crafted from PLA, a biodegradable and sustainable material, emphasizing its commitment to environmentally conscious design.
Combining aesthetics with sustainability, Bonk encourages the use of alternative technologies for producing beautiful home decor and sets a precedent for the future of home decor, where creativity, functionality, and environmental impact coexist harmoniously.
Wooden Production

My work combines traditional woodworking techniques with a minimalistic form, resulting in furniture that embodies a striking contrast between simplicity and intricate craftsmanship. The clean, understated lines of the designs highlight the beauty of classic joinery methods like dovetails and mortise and tenon. This balance creates a subtle tension between the minimalistic aesthetic and the complexity of the construction, where the refined techniques become the focal point. Each piece tells a story of precision and restraint, merging the art of traditional woodworking with the elegance of modern minimalism.

abaco
 Sunday project
 Abaco is a lamp (kind of) with modular units that can be moved around the system freely.
 The steel bars allow for low voltage electricity to be transmitted to the light units through a
 copper contact activated through pressure.
 It came out of a very old sketch, so I guess It might still change a bit along the process, I was
 thinking of having some slots for the light units on the top panel for when some are not in use…

Delta is a stress-free electric screwdriver designed with a focus on versatility, portability in the domestic environment and ease of battery charging.

Consisting of a charging case with a triangular cross-section, Delta is a device designed to simplify interaction and the way it is used, lowering the stress level.

The MXR-1 is a portable drum sequencer and controller designed for musicians and producers looking for a fresh take on electronic rhythm creation. Born out of a conversation at New Designers, the MXR-1 addresses the lack of innovation in drum sequencer design since the early 2000s. With a sleek and modern interface, it combines intuitive control with powerful sequencing capabilities. Whether you're a seasoned producer or just starting, the MXR-1 brings creativity and flexibility to your workflow, redefining what's possible in portable rhythm production.
an gravitationally adjustable dumbell ,so that ppl who train with weights, lose the hussle of exchanging weights all the time.

Do you like the smell of coffee in the morning?

What if instead of waking up to annoying sounds, you woke up to the smell of good coffee ready to start your day?

Sunrise is an alarm clock coffee maker. 

Instead of setting the typical alarm clock with annoying noises to wake you up the next day, you can leave the Sunrise coffee maker ready on your bedside table.

In the morning, at the time you set, Sunrise will start making your coffee. While it's preparing it, it will fill the room with the smell of good coffee.

So, what better way to start the day with energy?
